meanings.definition: Unpleasantly damp and sticky to the touch.
meanings.sent1: Her hands felt clammy after holding the cold drink.
meanings.sent2: The clammy towel stuck to the wet skin.
meanings.sent3: The clammy handshake left a lasting impression.
meanings.sent4: The clammy weather made the windows fog up.
meanings.sent5: The clammy mud squished under his feet as he walked.

meanings.definition: Covered with a cold, sticky moisture.
meanings.sent1: The clammy walls of the cave sent shivers down his spine.
meanings.sent2: The clammy fabric of the raincoat clung to her body.
meanings.sent3: The clammy cat's paws left tiny prints on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The clammy mist enveloped the entire forest.
meanings.sent5: The clammy sensation of the ice cube on his skin was refreshing.
